meanings.definition: The property of exhibiting different colors when viewed from different angles.
meanings.sent1: The crystal's dichroism was evident as it shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The artist used dichroism in the painting to create a unique visual effect.
meanings.sent3: The dichroism of the chameleon's skin made it look like a walking rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her personality had a dichroism, showing different sides to different people.
meanings.sent5: The dichroism of the soap bubbles captivated the children at the party.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of having two different colors.
meanings.sent1: The dichroism of the butterfly's wings fascinated the biologist.
meanings.sent2: The gemstone's dichroism made it highly sought after by collectors.
meanings.sent3: The dichroism of the traffic lights confused the colorblind driver.
meanings.sent4: The dichroism of the sky during sunset painted a breathtaking scene.
meanings.sent5: The dichroism of the flower petals added a touch of elegance to the garden.
